column4: hi all ... Im running a fresh install of edgy and have a dell widescreen monitor which I am having trouble configuring. I have 915resolution installed and its not listing my resolution
I have tried most of the things in the forums and all seem to result in a broken x
I'm not able to achieve my monitor's optimum resolution either.  Sometimes we just have to deal with what we're given.  :)
really, its pretty badly stretched
what resolution is it running currently?
fresh install?  have you `sudo apt-get upgrade` 'ed yet?
I have tried the dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg but it just broke x :)
you're working with a fresh install of Edgy right?
has your fresh install gone through it's "automatic update" yet, to your knowledge?
yep
what video card are you using?
umm that where im not so sure how do I find out ?
there's a command to display the video card only, but I cannot remember it.  Pastebin the output of the command `lspci` for me.  do you know how to use pastebin?
just looked at the device manager says Intel 82865G Integrated graphics controlor
its a dell box
excellent.  and when your reconfigured the Xserver, you selected one of the drivers that began with "i", correct?  Like i810, or something?
yep
not really sure.  are other resolutions just as stretched?
yeah ... if I edit xorg.conf and only have the 1680x1050 it just gives an error screen
thanks for your help, will keep playing
what about selecting someting like 1280x760 (or thereabouts). Does that lead to a stretched screen?
will try that too
i can't achieve my best resolution either and I too have a widescreen and a i810 driver.  Hmmm.........
